title: Drawing (France)
medium: Black chalk, pen, dark ink, brush, grey water colors.
inscribed: Writtne above, at right in pencil: "C. HUNTIN DEL., 176 THALER."  Written below, at left, at the back of the mounting cardboard, in 18th Century writing; "No. 8 Charles Hutin," in the lower right corner, in a later hand: "Med Au"
description: Horizontal rectangle. Galatea is shown sitting in a shell, leaning upon her left arm. Three mermen and a naiad supprt the shell. Another naiad offers pearls and other gifts to Galatea. At left is a dolphin with a child sitting on it and carrying a  a lighted torch. At right, merman leaning upon a dolphin blows a horn shell he holds with his left hand, and a swimming naiad. The background is is formed at right by a slightly sketched relief. Above are three sections of an iron railing.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing (France). Black chalk, pen, dark ink, brush, grey water colors.. 
1940-21-16
